skill.name: plan-directory
skill.description: Create or update a structured plan directory with a master PLAN.md index and numbered task files (001-*.md). Each task file includes goal, dependencies, scope, checklist, tests, and completion criteria. Use when scaffolding a repeatable project plan in markdown, especially when the user wants a master index plus per-task files with checkboxes that are checked off as work completes.

skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains markdown documentation defining how an LLM should create structured project plans. Uses standard MCP tools (Read, Write, Edit, Glob, Bash) for file operations.

content.user_title: Create structured project plans with task files
content.value_statement: Complex projects need organized task breakdowns. This skill creates a master PLAN.md index plus numbered task files (001-999) with goals, checklists, tests, and completion criteria. Perfect for repeatable execution by AI agents or engineers.
actual_capabilities: Create a master PLAN.md index file for project overviews
Generate numbered task files (001-*.md) with standard sections
Add checklists, tests, and completion criteria to each task
Update existing plans by adding tasks or marking progress
limitations: Only creates markdown files; does not execute project tasks
Does not integrate with external project management tools
User must provide task list details for plan creation
Does not auto-generate tasks from a high-level description

use_cases.title: Scaffold feature development
use_cases.description: Break down features into executable tasks with tests and clear completion criteria for AI or team execution.

use_cases.title: Create project roadmaps
use_cases.description: Document project scope, dependencies, and milestones in a format both humans and AI agents can follow.

use_cases.title: Enable repeatable AI execution
use_cases.description: Create structured plans that AI agents can work through methodically, tracking progress checkbox by checkbox.

prompt_templates.title: Basic plan creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan called [Project Name] with tasks for [list main goals]. Use the plan-directory skill. Put it in docs/plans/[project-slug]/.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed task breakdown
prompt_templates.scenario: Add specific tasks to existing plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new task to the [existing-plan] plan for [task description]. The task should include: checklist items for [specific steps], tests to run [test commands], and completion criteria for [definition of done].

prompt_templates.title: Progress tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: I've completed task [NNN] in the [plan-name] plan. Update the task file to check off all items and also check the task in PLAN.md.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-dependency planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive plan for [complex initiative] with [number] tasks. Include dependencies between tasks where applicable, mark which tasks can run in parallel, and specify test commands for each task.

output_examples.input: Create a plan for adding user authentication to my app. Use JWT tokens and include login, logout, and password reset.
output: Created PLAN.md - master index with task overview
Created 001-user-model.md - User model and database setup
Created 003-login-endpoint.md - Login and logout API endpoints

best_practices: Break tasks into 3-8 checklist items each for focused execution
Include runnable test commands or specific QA steps in every task
Commit the initial plan to version control before starting work
anti_patterns: Putting detailed steps in PLAN.md instead of task files
Using vague checklist items like 'Set up database' instead of specific actions
Renumbering tasks after work starts (breaks references and history)

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code, OpenAI Codex, and any LLM that supports MCP tools (Read, Write, Edit, Glob, Bash).

faq.question: What is the maximum number of tasks supported?
faq.answer: Task files use 3-digit numbering (001-999). For plans exceeding 999 tasks, use sub-plans in nested directories.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing project management tools?
faq.answer: This skill creates markdown files only. You can export or copy content to other tools manually or via custom scripts.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only writes markdown files you specify. It does not send data anywhere or access files outside requested directories.

faq.question: Why are my checkboxes not updating?
faq.answer:: Ensure you invoke the skill with 'update' mode when marking progress. Check that PLAN.md and task files are in the same directory.

faq.question: How does this compare to simple todo lists?
faq.answer: Plan directory provides structure, dependencies, tests, and completion criteria. Unlike todo lists, it creates executable, verifiable plans for AI agents.
